intro: Astrochlaena whytei, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces tiny, capsule-like fruits that contain its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
